result.execSummary:
The defendant Audrey G. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: ***Based on a hearing held May 6, 2015 the court determines restution in the amount of $919.08 to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $100 starting August 1, 2015***  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

***The DNA surcharge in the amount of $200 that was omitted from the original Judgment of Conviction in error has been added.*** Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with D. Gauger and/or R. Gauger except by text message solely for purposes of discussing the minor child the parties have in common.

Defendant to complete an Anger Managment program, Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program or the equivalent together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent. Uncharged referral for Bail Jumping 2/23/2015 dismissed and read in. Uncharged referral for Theft 2/24/2015 dismissed and read in. Uncharged referral for Bail Jumping 2/28/2015 dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Exhibits 1-5 (Exhibit 6 not received by the court)

Case called @ 02:04 p.m. Defendant Audrey G. Johnson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson - the defendant is stipulating to four items totaling $108.10. Atty Groh - Stipulated amount is accurate and the defendant has brought some of the items in question to return to the victim. Victim R.G. called for testimony. Direct exam by ADA Anderson. Exhibits 2-5 marked and entered. DE testifies to exhibit 2-5. Exhibit 6 marked. The court declines to receive exhibit 6. Cross exam by Atty Groh. Re-direct by ADA Anderson. The State has no further evidence. Atty Groh calls the DE. Direct exam by Atty Groh. Cross exam by ADA Anderson. Evidence closed. The court orders restitution in the amount of $919.08 to be repaid in monthly increments of $100 starting August 1, 2015.
Restitution hearing at 05-06-2015 01:45 pm
Defendant's Request for Restitution Hearing

Restitution Summary - $1622.08

Case called @ 3:30 p.m. Defendant Audrey G. Johnson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by victim R.G. Uncharged referral for BJump 2/23/2015 - DRI. Uncharged referral for Theft 2/24/2015 - DRI. Uncharged referral for BJump 2/28/2015 - DRI. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding sentencing. Statement by DE. The court finds that there is a domestic abuse component to the conviction. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: Anger Management Program - either DAAP or the equivalent,  NC w/D.Gauger and/or R. Gauger except by text message solely for the purposes of discussing the minor child the parties have in common, Restitution in the amount of $1622.08 unless written request for a hearing is filed within 10 days, if filed hearing to be held within 60 days, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-23-2015 02:30 pm

Case called @ 2:38 p.m. Defendant Audrey G. Johnson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The defendant is ready to proceed to plea/sentencing but there are Chapter 950 issues that need to be observed. The defendant does wish to have the the Court proceed on this matter and does not wish to have another Judge on this case.  NGP entered.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State's

Case called @ 12:36 p.m. Defendant Audrey G. Johnson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond - DE is on a PO Hold. Atty Szilagyi voices no objection to bond. Atty Szilagyi advises that the DE will be requesting a substitution of Judge.  Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
